column4: Question - On Gnome Shell in 11.10 when I hit the wireless network icon in the upper right, some of the wifi networks show up as "UNKNOWN". Any idea why??
I don't think so. at work we have 3 SSIDs, and two showed up as unknown while the other I could read.
Does the same thing happen when you "iwlist wlan0 scan"?
I'm at a hospital now and I see like 4 networks. The one I'm connected to is an ATTWIFI hotspot, the others are unknown. So HERE I'm not sure... but at work we don't hide our SSIDs.
I see a bunch of unknown entries, yes.
being I'm in a hospital (and its packed) I wonder if its peoples laptops that have hotspot capability?
wireless driver problems, that's all I can say
is "unknown" normally an indication of the ssid being hidden?
well, I suppose that's possible but I find it hard to believe as it happened to TWO completely different model laptops.
11.10 32 bit on both with gnome shell.
Well, then a problem with wext
I wonder if I log out and into unity what would happen to nework manager
perhaps thats worth checking out quick...
